Respect, Expertise, Integrity and Empowerment are at the heart of every interaction at Centerstone, and particularly rooted in our beliefs toward diversity and inclusion. Our approach to diversity is simple—it’s about embracing everyone.  Together, we continue to develop an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices and experiences of our employees. It powers our innovation and connects us closer to each other, to our clients and the communities we serve.  We strive to create a workplace that reflects the growing world around us, and where everyone feels empowered, safe and welcomed.

job_title: Staff Mathematician - Data Analysis and Machine Learning
location: 1 Bethel Valley Rd, Oak Ridge, TN 37830
job_Description: Requisition Id 6004 Overview: The Data Analysis and Machine Learning (DAML) Group is seeking an exceptional mathematician to work on the development of rigorous theory and algorithms for applying data analysis (DA) and machine learning (ML) techniques, customized to large-scale scientific application interests of the Department of Energy (DOE). In particular, the application of DA and ML to scientific discovery will require an entirely new focus on algorithmic development and mathematical rigor, than what has been produced by the commercial sector. The application of DA and ML to problems of interest to the DOE, or for scientific discovery, must leverage the large body of high performance algorithmic development with mathematics driving advances in the following major thrusts of research: (1) design data reduction methods for streaming scientific data that incorporate physics into compression, capable of utilizing high performance and edge computing. (2) formulate novel mathematical tasks which are achievable given the type (plentiful or sparse) and form (labeled or unlabeled, static or online, deterministic or noisy) of observational data; (3) design of architectures/models which accurately capture the complexities of the data, with robust estimates of confidence in predictions and compressed quantities of interest on defined domains; (4) fast and scalable algorithms to fit the proposed models to data, with a theory that explains the convergence and success of these techniques; and (45) detailed re-analysis of the performance of the trained models to determine underlying processes that govern the given data. This particular position focuses on the potential for the use and development of tools from the mathematical sciences, as opposed to traditional statistical theory or engineering tools, to support and advance the understanding of DA and ML technology, and to accelerate algorithmic performance on leadership computing platforms. Major Duties and Responsibilities: The position requires collaboration within a multi-disciplinary research environment consisting of mathematicians, computational scientists, computer scientists, experimentalists, and engineers/physicists conducting basic and applied research in support of the Laboratory’s missions. Specific responsibilities include: Participating in the development of innovative theoretical analysis and computational methodologies for data analysis and/or machine learning technologies, customized to large-scale scientific applications, including: additive manufacturing; quantum material design; scientific imaging for material discovery; medical and tomographic imaging; population and evolutionary dynamics; cyber security and power grid analysis; consumer behavior and market analysis; as well as uncertainty quantification for engineered systems. Collaboration with experts from various scientific disciplines and applications, and following team planning, goals and quality processes. Authoring peer reviewed papers, technical papers, reports and proposals. Maintaining memberships in professional, academic, and research organizations. ORNL Ethics and Conduct: As a member of the ORNL scientific community, you will be expected to commit to ORNL's Research Code of Conduct. Our full code of conduct, and a statement by the Lab Director's office can be found here: https://www.ornl.gov/content/research-integrity Basic Qualifications: Ph.D. in Mathematics, Engineering, Data/Computational Science, or a field relevant to the job duties mentioned. 2+ years of relevant research experience outside of Ph.D. Preferred Qualifications: Strong theoretical background in: constructive approximation; functional, complex, and real analysis; statistics; as well as numerical analysis and approximation of partial differential equations. Expertise in deep learning and reinforced learning; graphical/network models; kernel methods; sparse grid methods; compressed sensing, data reduction, thresholding, and greedy approaches; stochastic optimization; as well as convex and non-convex regularizations. Demonstrated experience in the design and implementation of numerical algorithms in one or more high-level computing languages within a team environment. Ability to program in Python and knowledge of Machine Learning/Deep Learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc. Effective interpersonal skills. Demonstrated written and oral communication skills. Questions: Contact Rick Archibald (archibaldrk@ornl.gov). Please reference the position title and number when corresponding about this position. ORNL Ethics and Conduct: As a member of the ORNL scientific community, you will be expected to commit to ORNL's Research Code of Conduct. Our full code of conduct, and a statement by the Lab Director's office can be found here: https://www.ornl.gov/content/research-integrity Benefits at ORNL: UT Battelle offers an exceptional benefits package to include matching 401K, Pension Plan, Paid Vacation and Medical / Dental plan. Onsite amenities include Credit Union, Medical Clinic and free Fitness facilities. Relocation: UT Battelle offers a wide range of relocation benefits for individuals and families to make it easier to come and work here. If you are invited to interview, please ask your Recruiter about relocating with ORNL. This position will remain open for a minimum of 5 days after which it will close when a qualified candidate is identified and/or hired. We accept Word (.doc, .docx), Adobe (unsecured .pdf), Rich Text Format (.rtf), and HTML (.htm, .html) up to 5MB in size. Resumes from third party vendors will not be accepted; these resumes will be deleted and the candidates submitted will not be considered for employment. If you have trouble applying for a position, please email ORNLRecruiting@ornl.gov. ORNL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans, are encouraged to apply. UT-Battelle is an E-Verify employer.

Job Description We are seeking a junior quantitative fixed income researcher for our Nashville office. The successful candidate would join the quantitative fixed income research team and work closely with other members of the team. The candidate would work in collaboration with others on various quantitative aspects of the investment process in the fixed income division at AllianceBernstein. This includes but is not limited to: Continued development, maintenance and improvement of existing interest rate, credit, emerging markets and fx models and strategies. Development of cross-sectional and time-series alpha within and across various asset classes including rates, credit, emerging markets, and multi-sector. Systematic portfolio construction and automated execution. Development of liquidity tools/models to enable efficient portfolio construction. Portfolio construction /optimization, hedging strategies, and relative value analysis within rates, credit and emerging markets. Curation and preparation of data sets and entity mappings. Maintenance of production code and the production environment. Reporting tools and Risk analysis. Continued development and expansion of our quantitative research framework abAlphaLabs. The candidate would work in close collaboration with other team members and mentored by more experienced members. He/She would work on various types of quantitative problems in relation to our fixed income investment process including statistical modelling, and historical data analysis. The candidate will have a strong modern data science bend. Job Qualifications The candidate should hold a master’s degree in Finance, Financial Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Economics, Electrical Engineering, or related fields. The applicant needs to have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and ability to take ownership of projects with a strong focus on quality is a must. Prior exposure to modern data science methods and tools and fluency in python is a must. Experience working with SQL databases is required. Experience in Fixed Income, data-science, machine learning and systematic strategies a plus. Ability to manipulate and analyze large sets of data using python. Hands on experience in the use of essential python libraries such as pandas, numpy, sklearn and other modern data science tools is a strong plus. Ability to manipulate and analyze large sets of data using python. Hands on experience in the use of essential python libraries such as pandas, numpy, sklearn and other modern data science tools is a strong plus. Group Description AllianceBernstein’s Fixed Income Quantitative Research team plays a key role in AllianceBernstein’s investment process. Among its responsibilities are the development of quantitative models and methods that are integral to the fixed income investment process as well as the development and management of systematic investment portfolios. job_title: Data Engineer II - Patient Data / AI / ML
job_Description: Data Engineer, Patient Data (Remote-US) Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact. As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities. Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life. Data engineers at Change Healthcare are software developers who design, build and launch efficient & reliable data pipelines to move and transform data (both large and small amounts). They design elegant interfaces between internal services and internal customers. Design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production. We will be asking you to Design, build and launch efficient & reliable data pipelines to move and transform data (both large and small amounts). Assemble large, complex data sets that meet business requirements. Optimize data delivery and re-design infrastructure for greater scalability. Develop the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources Develop analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics. To be effective at this role you will need to be Curious - willing to learn new things and try new things, able to implement prototypes, rolling up your sleeves Data-Driven - able to drive decisions and influence based on data. Sense of Urgency - bring an agile, let’s get things done attitude We are assuming that you have MS degree in computer science or related field. Comfortable with modern programming languages (Python, Java, …) Familiarity with key value stores and NoSQL databases like HBase, Cassandra, Hive etc. Familiarity with shell scripting using Bash or Zsh. #li-remote Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system! ABS Group is a global company that provides data-driven risk and reliability solutions and technical services that help our clients enhance the safety, integrity, quality and environmental efficiency of their critical assets and operations. Our multidisciplinary team of management consultants, data scientists, data analysts, and cybersecurity specialists work together to develop innovative solutions for a wide range of complex challenges. If you are a motivated self-starter with intellectual curiosity, we’re just what you’re looking for.  Federal Departments and Agencies such as the Department of Homeland Security, Department of Transportation, and Department of Interior require cutting-edge contract support to provide technical expertise and mission support in cybersecurity, engineering, policy and analysis, project management, security and resiliency, and risk management. ABS Group has earned a reputation for technical expertise and data-driven solutions to help our clients understand and manage risk, optimize business performance and support the journey to operational excellence.  We are looking for a Data Analyst / Data Scientist - based in Knoxville, TN, who can travel periodically to Washington, D.C. - to lead the creation and application of tools for gathering, transformation, and preparation of data for analysis, visualization, and insight. You will apply data mining tools to extract critical data from unstructured data sources and identify patterns that will improve our customers’ operations. The ideal candidate is a team player, critical thinker, and problem solver that enjoys working in a dynamic collaborative environment. This position will require moderate travel based on client and project need.  Responsibilities  Perform research to identify relevant data sources and automate collection processes:  Pre-process structured and unstructured data  Analyze datasets to identify trends and anomalies in data  Build predictive models using statistical and machine-learning techniques  Troubleshoot, debug, and make improvements to existing machine learning algorithms  Create technical documentation as needed   Support deployment of machine learning applications into client operations  Solve complex, safety, security, and cybersecurity problems facing our government clients  Develop creative, innovative ideas for risk analysis and management:  Be able to translate business needs and gaps into requirements documentation and initial design concepts  Meet deadlines in fast-paced, goal-oriented environment  Be comfortable presenting your work to a small audience (10-20 people) conveying data results or facilitating discussion to support a client decision  Maintain a positive working environment and can-do attitude to foster productive and healthy team and client relationships   Qualifications Qualifications  Required  Minimum of 3 years of experience as a data analyst / data scientist  Experience programming in multiple languages (e.g., Python, R, VBA)  Extensive experience in Python-based data mining and transformation techniques: natural language processing, optical character recognition, web scraping, etc.  Strong statistical analysis skills  Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI and Tableau  Analytical mindset and business acumen  Problem-solving aptitude  Excellent communication and presentation skills  BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field  US citizenship required; eligibility to obtain and maintain Top Secret clearance  Periodic travel required to Washington, D.C.   Preferred  Graduate degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, or other quantitative field  Proficient with the Git version control system  Cybersecurity certification  Active Top Secret clearance   ABS Group is committed to the equal employment opportunity of its employees and prohibits discrimination against any employee or qualified applicant on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status, or other non-work-related characteristics that may be protected under the law of the Federal Government or specific state employment laws.  Company: ABSG Consulting, Inc.

St. Jude is looking for a Senior Data Analyst II that will have the exciting opportunity to put together reports and analytics for excutives at St. Jude. This person will provide analysis of both quantitative and qualitative healthcare and administrative data from various data sources in support of institutional decisions. This person will bring significant value to both the technical and non-technical sides of the organization by performing complex exploratory analysis for further technical development or by developing high quality, impactful dashboards using charts, graphs, drilldown, navigation and other data visualization techniques. The position is responsible for the day-to-day design, development, monitoring, documentation and support of all products as well as mentoring and guiding junior staff members. Bachelor's degree in a related field is required Master's degree in Computer Science, MIS or related area preferred Six (6) years' experience in a related position or IT area required which includes at least four (4) years of data analytics experience building data visualization, scorecards, dashboards or reports using tools such as Cognos, SAS, Business Objects, Power BI, Tableau, Oracle or Sysbase Prefer advanced knowledge of Excel, Power BI and Power Apps Prefer experience with SQL and knowledge of query tools to access data products such SQL Server and Oracle, Azure, etc Experience with multidimensional data sources, star schemas, financial, grants and HR data, and proficiency with documentation is preferred COVID-19 vaccine: As of September 10, 2021, St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital has mandated the COVID-19 vaccine for all employees, excluding those with an approved medical or religious accommodation, as a condition of employment.  St. Jude is an Equal Opportunity Employer No Search Firms: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. Please do not call or email. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee or other representative at St. Jude via email, the internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place and approved by HR will result in no fee being paid in the event the candidate is hired by St. Jude.

Senior Data Analyst - Transfer Center  - 220000005I Transfer Center  Division of Enrollment Management  University of Tennessee, Knoxville  POSITION ANNOUNCEMENT   The Office of the Transfer Center at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, (UTK) invites applications and nominations for our Senior Data Analyst position. We are seeking candidates who can contribute in meaningful ways to the diversity and intercultural goals of the University.  The University and Region  UTK is the state’s flagship, land-grant university. We are a Research 1 university with 11 colleges and more than 30,000 students. With new leadership at the system, university, and college levels, UTK is poised for dramatic positive change focused on solving some of the most audacious, pressing problems our country and world face today. The city of Knoxville is a hidden gem surrounded by eight gorgeous lakes, with a beautiful and walkable downtown, a diverse music scene including internationally recognized festivals, active neighborhoods, unique restaurants, and a robust offering of diverse cultural and outdoor activities. UTK is located within easy driving distance to the Great Smoky Mountains, Atlanta, Nashville, Asheville, Charlotte, Louisville and Cincinnati. It is only a day’s drive to Memphis, Chicago, and Washington D.C. Knoxville and the surrounding counties have a population of more than 850,000 people. The Division  The Enrollment Management (EM) division comprises more than 170 full-time staff who serve our students through the following departments and functions: Undergraduate Admissions, International Recruitment, Transfer Center, One Stop Student Services, Financial Aid and Scholarships, University Registrar, EM Communications, and Research & Analytics. The Office of Enrollment Management is committed to our Vision, Mission and Values. We are passionate about fulfilling our land-grant mission of accessible education and making an impact that will transform lives through the student experience.  The Position This position is responsible for data related transfer operations and course articulation tasks. This position is responsible for development, testing, maintenance (programming) and integration of multiple systems with other systems such as Banner, OnBase, Slate and other interactive transfer equivalency databases. Supports the university’s Transfer and TN Reconnect initiatives, and provides miscellaneous support throughout the Office of Undergraduate Admissions Transfer Center. Independently evaluates and improves user interfaces, analyzes and resolves technical and end user issues, participates in planning groups and training sessions regarding the upgrade and implementation of various enrollment-related systems, supports the university's Transfer and TN Reconnect initiatives, and provides miscellaneous support through the Undergraduate Admissions Transfer Center. Works with UT System administrators on state transfer initiatives: Reverse Transfer, Transfer Pathways, and State Degree Audit System. Required Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree; 1-2 years relevant experiance  Extensive experience with computer programs in a Windows environment  Experience with word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, and PDF documents  Creating and presenting training documentation in paper, digital, and in-person formats.  Computer programming and/or PL/SQL or other procedural language experience preferred  Experience with higher education policies and procedures preferred  Familiarity with the curricular process preferred  Familiarity with student information systems preferred  Preferred Education and Experience: This position must be comfortable with learning new software and implementation of new processes. This position requires a person with technical skills and experience since the encoding process is complex.  Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Superior analytical and problem solving skills  Strong written and verbal communication  Acute detail- and task-orientation  Ability to accurately document technical processes  Ability to work independently and in a team environment  Ability to work with a wide variety of populations  Ability to multitask  Understanding of how discrete processes are interrelated  Understanding of the broad impact/consequences of encoding decisions  Desire to research the history of context of issues for complete resolution  Effective communications skills  Ability to work with diverse populations in an inclusive manner  Applicants should submit a cover letter detailing relevant experience along with a resume and the name, e-mail address, and telephone number of three to five professional references.

Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Job Description The Team: The Data Science team in Salesforce’s Digital Success and Scale (DSS) organization creates data science products that drive customer success. The team works with executives, success managers, sales, renewal managers, and product managers across DSS and Salesforce to discover and analyze opportunities for growth and to provide actionable insights supporting business decision making.     Role:  We are looking for machine learning engineers who are passionate about building scalable production machine learning applications. As a key member of the data science team you will have immense opportunities to work on a broad range of business/technical problems and technologies, build machine learning models, design/automate/deploy production machine learning pipelines. You will be working with a group of world-class data scientists, program managers and business analysts to build intelligent services for both internal teams and customer-facing products. We share a passion for problem solving, new technologies, and learning, so you will be highly encouraged to explore new technologies and come up with innovative solutions that could take the team’s data science machine learning engineering capability to the next level.     Requirements:  In detail, you will: Work with large amounts of structured and unstructured data. Work with internal stakeholders to explore and understand business data. Apply complex analytical techniques to derive actionable insights. Design and implement data science applications. Design, build, automate, deploy and maintain machine learning production pipelines. Implement machine learning model lifecycle management framework. Build model performance tracking tools, to monitor month over month model performance, identify drivers and provide recommendations for model performance improvement Collaborate with other salesforce data science and engineering teams to establish, formulate and build insight-based feature store. Author technical documentation and reports to communicate process and results   Qualifications: Preferred Experience and Skills: Bachelor or Masters degree in Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related field with project experience in machine learning and statistical modeling 3-5 years hands on experience in building data science applications and machine learning pipelines. Working knowledge of one or more SQL languages: Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift, etc. Working knowledge of one or more scientific programming languages/packages: Python or R Development experience in at least one programming language: Python, Java, C++, etc. Knowledge of common machine learning and statistics frameworks and concepts Experience with large data sets, distributed computing and cloud computing platforms. MLOps experience is highly regarded. Experience with Automation tools like Airflow is plus Salesforce experience/certification is a plus but not required. Data Scientist, Global Operational Excellence   Job Description  Kimberly-Clark’s Global Business Services (GBS) operates across 5 sites with nearly 1500 employees worldwide and continues to grow.Business functions/processes within the GBS scope are Accounting-to-Report, Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash, Treasury, Management Reporting, Real Estate and Facilities Management. The Global Delivery Network (GDN) is the operational component of GBS which delivers cost savings to the enterprise by reducing complexity, delivering services more efficiently and effectively, and freeing up capacity to further grow, enabling business teams to focus on profitably growing our business.  The Data Scientist will lead efforts to drive standardization for Global GBS Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) creating a comprehensive document management library and a thorough governance process with oversight for SOPs. In addition, this role will coordinate the annual review and update of Business Continuity Plans globally for GBS.  The Data Scientist will define a set of core SOP metrics for all process teams globally as well as a framework for capturing and reporting these metrics to drive visibility to and enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of SOP compliance. Having a global storage solution housing SOPs and other critical process documentation is vital. This role will be key in researching, leading and implementing this solution.  Further, this role will be the point of contact and lead subject matter expert for any global and/or cross functional projects with SOPs. Finally, in keeping with a lean mindset, this role will take action on superfluous, duplicative or outdated documents in collaboration with process teams.   ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  This role takes work direction from the Sr. Manager of GBS Global Operational Excellence and collaborates closely with the regional OPEX teams and regional process SMEs to support business and functional leaders to by developing and implementing actions to advance “everyday excellence” through standardized, centrally located, updated critical process documentation.  This role serves as the global SOP Analyst by providing expert guidance in the creation, maintenance, and improvements of the process documentation.  Lead the efforts and process to gather and create SOP requirements or process improvements as well as annual reviews of the Business continuity plans. Provide oversight and act as the source of knowledge for all SOPs, BCPs and internal policy document processes. Lead the analysis and recommendations for SOP effectiveness and related metrics. Drive activities to ensure the accuracy, governance, clarity & consistency, and maintenance of SOPs. Lead the escalation/communication of risks and issues as appropriate for both SOPs and BCPs. Manage all aspects of the SOP document control and approval system and processes. Support the communication and training of SOPs to operational teams. Provide guidance to Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) on how to document processes, develop flowcharts, draft SOPs, as well as the development of checklists, communication templates and desktop guides to augment SOPs. Conduct staff interviews and review/research work products to aid in the development of SOPs and BCPs. Develop and define the terminology used in SOP/BCP documents so they are clearly understood by all audiences that read and/or use them. Track all SOPs from creation to implementation including sending reminders for SOPs about to requiring review or about to expire. Provide oversight on SOPs and/or training materials for contractually provided activities.  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:   Education required:  Four-year under-graduate degree  Experience:  Three to five years professional business process experience preferably with a Global Business Service environment Previous experience with process improvements, process analysis, drafting SOPs, creating SOP libraries, leading training Experience with Celonis is a plus Excellent written and oral communication skills, and ability to speak and present effectively Ability to build quick rapport with all levels of process teams and SMEs to give them high quality, responsive service. Ability to collect, organize, analyze, distill and document significant amounts of information and process steps Ability to lead without authority to ensure documents move through the required review and approval steps Lean orYellow Belt Six Sigma Certification with project experienceis desired Proficient English speaker and local regional language  Leadership Skills:  Exceptional leadership and influencing skills Challenge the status quo and facilitate different perspectives to drive solutions Capable of leading teams and working in a matrix organization, driving collaboration across businesses and functions with minimum supervision Demonstrated personal credibility and positive energy Enthusiastic, resilient, and able to manage stressful situations Innovative capabilities, requiring strategic thinking and foresight  Functional Business skills:  Exceptional analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to analyze business processes and workflows Strong discipline to analyze and design end-to-end business process Demonstrated problem solving, facilitation and business acumen skills  Global VISA and Relocation Specifications:   Primary Location  USA-TN-Knoxville   Additional Locations  USA-GA-Atlanta-Roswell, USA-IL-Chicago, USA-TX-Dallas, USA-WI-Neenah   Worker Type  Employee   Worker Sub-Type  Regular   Time Type  Full time

The purpose of this role is to join and be an integral part of the data science function, planning, and leading projects to deliver the Powered By Data project across Mars Petcare divisions using the ecosystem of data available. In this role, you will apply knowledge and experience of data science / ML techniques to our unique data sets and lead data science projects. This will involve building a clear understanding of the potential benefits that connected data and analytics can bring and supporting this vision with stakeholders. The role involves hands-on delivery of analytics and insight as well as leading and mentoring others. Collaboration with stakeholders will be essential throughout to ensure the insights are actionable and that the business is ready to apply them to deliver the benefits. The role requires end-to-end expertise from data, analytics and insight delivery to stakeholder engagement and support of benefit realization. Being self-starting and self-sufficient while also communicating and collaborating effectively within the team and beyond is key. What are we looking for? 8+ years varied technical experience in delivering statistical analytics, data science and insight on large-scale consumer data sets across multiple sectors. Strong preference for candidates with experience in packaged goods, or retail / DTC, or healthcare Demonstrable experience of using data science and advanced analytics to generate business value and change Demonstrable experience of planning and managing multiple projects in parallel Excellent knowledge of Python (NumPy, pandas, etc.) is required; Familiarity with PySpark is also desirable Capacity and enthusiasm for coaching and mentoring less experienced data scientists Must have excellent communication skills, and interact effectively with all levels of internal / external business stakeholders to engage and Influence Superior planning, project management and organizational orchestration skills and a strong attention to detail Truly inspired by, and want to live, our purpose of creating a better world for pets. 4 + years experience writing productional level code Can estimate time required to productionise code Understands potential pitfalls in code productionization Review and update production ready code Understands the performance issues for performance code Also, desirable: Passion for growing and strengthening a business using data driven / ML approaches Enjoys explaining how models and systems work to both non-technical and technical stakeholders. Experience working on Azure cloud computing Personal traits: Comfortable with ambiguity, with a passion for collaboration to achieve objectives Quick learner, ability to understand and simplify highly complex scenarios. What will be your key responsibilities? The role reports into the Head of Data Science - North America. The primary responsibilities are: Plan and lead data science projects to understand and predict pet and pet owner behaviors Review work of team members identifying optimum methodologies, advising on implementation, and checking business logic Use machine learning techniques, visualizations, & statistical analysis to gain insight into various data sets – some readily available, and some you create and curate yourself Collaborate with internal and external teams to ensure we focus on pet-centric product and service recommendations and be a key player in our network of talent Mentoring, coaching, and inspiring the team Manage multiple projects Develop compelling stories that provide insight into the drivers of business performance and Pet/Pet Owner behavior Contribute to a high performing data science function What can you expect from Mars? Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles. Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today. Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University. An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Job Summary We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Distribution, Enablement & Intelligence Team (DE&I), part of Business Transformation. This role presents an opportunity to drive change, foster a culture of data-driven decision-making - increasingly putting data to work to drive customer acquisition, retention and business impact leveraging data. The Data Scientist will analyze and model large sets of structured and unstructured data to create actionable insights for members of our distribution team. The Data Scientist will work closely with Distribution, Enablement & Intelligence (DE&I) team members and business partners to uncover and effectively present insights that inform strategic decisions and business activity. The Data Scientist will also be responsible, in partnership with the business, for establishing the roadmap and vision for DE&I Data Science, including AB’s state-of-the-art Distribution Platform. Job Description Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Analyze and evaluate large quantities of data in relational databases and unstructured forms of data, effectively balancing quality, availability and timeliness Interpret the results of modeled data to create actionable insights for Distribution teams Explore new data sources and use cases to support data as a strategic asset Perform data acquisition and data transformation in support of data science projects Assess the integrity, accuracy and quality of data sources and data collection techniques Develop, tune and deploy data science models to produce signals for distribution teams to drive customer acquisition, sales and retention (  e.g.  next best action) Design and run processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance, accuracy and impact Create new, experimental frameworks to collect data Deliver presentations around insights to be delivered to business users at all levels: strategic, tactical, operational, and across functions Advise D E&I team members on platform functionality and data science best practices Implement user requirements for new Distribution platform insights and analytics Coordinate with relevant stakeholders to implement models, gather feedback and monitor outcomes Advise DE&I team on data quality risks/issues and recommend/implement remediations Job Qualifications & Key Attributes The ideal candidate should have: Master’s degree in data science, information engineering, statistics, or mathematics 4+ years of experience in database and data modeling design, data quality principles, source file data extraction, complex data transformation and load processes Expertise using statistical computer languages (R or Python) to manipulate data, develop analytical models and draw insights from large datasets Experience building visualizations using PowerBI Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, Azure Synapse, Amazon Redshift or Google BigQuery Experience designing and working with complex data platforms and solutions architecture In-depth knowledge of data integration solutions, developments, and implementations Experience working in an agile environment High proficiency in data science and software engineering Strong programming ability with knowledge of industry leading technologies and capabilities Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of peers, managers, executives, and subject matter experts Thorough understanding of how to interpret operational data and translate business needs into technical design and requirements Is solution oriented, focused on delivering the business and technical requirements for the Platform Is comfortable working with cross-functional teams and has proven success managing senior stakeholders Ability to partner across business and technology to deliver the most appropriate solution Candidate must be a self-starter, a dependable partner, and team player Candidate must be willing to take full ownership of projects, covering analysis, design and implementation, testing, and deployment Preferred 2+ years of experience in building, training and deployment of AI/ML models including deep learning 2+ years of experience in the investment management industry People of color, women, and those who identify as LGBTQ people are encouraged to apply.
